description: This course is a continuation of COP 2551.
It covers advanced object-oriented programming concepts, including inheritance, polymorphism, and exception handling.
Students will learn to use the Java programming language to develop software for desktop and web applications.
Topics of study include the fundamentals of the language, using lists, dictionaries, and creating functions and classes.
Each module contains lecture notes, assignments, and other resources.
There are coding demonstrations and exercises every week to practice the content.
Content in each module will be augmented by the required textbook, as well as additional content.
course.prerequisites: CGS 1821 and COP 2551 with a grade of C or better

outcomes.outcome: Understand the fundamentals of programming with classes and objects.
Write syntactically and semantically correct Java programs.
Analyze program requirements and design solutions using OOP principles.

objectives.objective: Write and execute basic Java programs that utilize sequential processing, variables, operators, and input/output functions.
Understand data types, variable scope, and file access
Recognize the properties and behaviors of classes and objects
Use the various types of selection structures
Use the various types of repetition structures
Use arrays and arraylists to store character and numeric data
Understand how to create and use functions
Understand how sequential data files are opened, read to and from, deleted, and merged
Understand the basic concepts of an object-oriented languages including inheritance, encapsulation, and polymorphism
Know proper use of exception handling
Understand and use JavaFX to create GUI-based applications
Utilize a relational database within a Java application

textbook.title: Starting Out with Java: Early Objects
textbook.author: Gaddis

contact.about:
preferred method of contact is via email. I will respond to emails within 24 hours on weekdays. Published office hours are times when I will be available on Zoom for real-time communication. If you need to meet at a different time, please email me to schedule an appointment.
Discord channels are also available for anytime communication with me and your classmates.

instructor.about: Over 30 years professional experience as a software engineer and program manager. I have worked for large and small companies.
